sub_title: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV
summary: Team player who can motivate others to excel in their task. Industrial automation has many areas of expertise but a common denominator lies with the human interaction. Tackling automation problems from that angle is what drives my interest when designing, building and maintaining applications.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Information and Communication Technology (ICT)

projects.title: Ad Software Development
projects.description:
Developing a curriculum for a new Associate degree called Ad Software Development. Defining the lessons on how to become an effective software developer. For this new education we are not using the old traditional way of software education. We are building a complete new way to pass the knowledge within this fast moving craft.
My role is as a consultant providing practical input from the field, As a part-time lector and team member developing the material for the lessons.
We will also develop a unique way to track student progress.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Writing the software design specification for the Traction Installation Noord/Zuidlijn Amsterdam
projects.description:
A new subway line (Noord/Zuidlijn) is being commissioned for city of Amsterdam. The traction installation provides the power for the subway. From 6 locations within the city the AC is converted to 750 VDC which is distributed throughout the whole subway line via switch matrices. These switch matrices are stand alone installations which are controlled via a redundant PLC configuration.

For this traction installation I wrote the software design specification. The specification described among other things: conventions to be used, overall and detailed architecture of the application, breakdown of the functionalities.

Besides writing the software design specification I coached the PLC programmer in PLC programming techniques, do's and don'ts, debugging tricks. All the knowledge I've gained in the past 25 years as a PLC developer.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Writing the functional specification for the Traction Installation Noord/Zuidlijn Amsterdam
projects.description:
A new subway line (Noord/Zuidlijn) is being commissioned for city of Amsterdam. The traction installation provides the power for the subway. From 6 locations within the city the AC is converted to 750 VDC which is distributed throughout the whole subway line via switch matrices. These switch matrices are stand alone installations which are controlled via a redundant PLC configuration. The PLC configuration consists of 2 Siemens S7-416H CPU's in separate racks and locations. All I/O is remote and connected through a redundant fiber optics network.

For this traction installation Iwrote the functional specification. The specification describes the functionality of the traction installation including the sub installation parts related to or controlled by the traction installation PLC. The functionality and the related requirements of the traction installation was gathered by interviewing different experts in the field, analyzing the electrical diagrams and my own personal experience.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Commissioning Grab crane
projects.description:
The electrical installation and some mechanical parts were completely overhauled. Months before I developed and programmed the main movements of the crane. At this point I needed to commission the software.
The main movements were commissioned and tuned for performance. The torque control between the hoist and close movements were tuned for optimal and fast load distribution in order to lift the grab with ore using both drives.
The interaction between the different movements, safety and special procedures were tested and optimized where needed.
Some parts of the electrical system were on request of the customer redesigned and optimized. The software was changed to accommodate these changes during commissioning. Tuning and optimizing  feedback to the operators was done during production.

The PLC used is a Siemens S7-400 series with Wago I/O modules, both regular and safety types.
Our positioning system uses the Hubner encoders with a Unit One profibus module, contact blocks and overspeed module.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Research reduce manual tasks
projects.description:
Writing a report on how to reduce the manual tasks during the process of planning. I've researched the issue by interviewing several people of the department and analyzing the tools they use. During the interviews and watching them do their jobs, I found that there were a lot of manual tasks that could easily be automated. This would increase productivity and reduce errors.
A report was written and recommendations were provided. A plan to work towards the recommendations is planned for next year.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Signal Routing between AEG PLC and WinCC
projects.description:
Designing and developing the application which can communicate between the AEG A-250 PLC and a Siemens WinCC application. The application reads the tags from an XML-file and creates the communication links with multiple PLC's. Data is transferred bi-directional.

The application is build using WPF and DevExpress components to give it a Windows 8 application style. Communication is performed through the libraries developed previously as mentioned under " Reverse Engineering a Protocol".
Creating a good user experience and interaction with the application was the main reason for using WPF as the UI technology.

My part was designing the application using WPF with the MVVM design pattern and the DevExpress components. Applying SOLID principles and unit testing in C# with Visual Studio 2013.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Programming Main Movements of a Grab Crane
projects.description:
The grab crane has the following main movements: Hoist, Close, Trolley, Gantry and Boom hoist. Opening and closing of the grab is controlled by introducing a speed difference between the hoist and the close drive. At the same time lifting a grab full of ore requires both movements to work together and perform a load balancing act during hoisting or lowering. This an in house developed control acting on both movements.

The trolley is a straight forward movement with a positioning control system. Depending on the current position of the grab and some other parts of the crane the trolley's target will be set to a safe value.

Another main movement, although not used so often, is lifting the boom. Lifting and lowering of the boom is done through an automatic sequence. The sequence handles all the necessary steps to lift and secure the boom or to lower and prepare for operation.

The gantry movement electrical and hydraulic specification were not yet finished. Therefore not part of my task.

My part was designing and developing the Siemens S7 PLC program for these movements using a Siemens 400-series with safety I/O. Connected to a PC running WinCC.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Teaching Python for Beginners
projects.description: Teaching ICT Service Management-students at HRO in Rotterdam scripting using Python as the scripting language. Same curriculum as a year ago a 2 semester course.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Reverse Engineering a Protocol
projects.description:
Communication with an old AEG KPH networkcard requires communicating with a KPH protocol. This protocol is based on Sinec H1, but not a 100%.
The customer needs the PLC with the KPH ethernetcard to communicate with WinCC via OPC. In order to get the data from the PLC to WinCC, I've researched the interaction between the KPH networkcard and a running Factory Link application. From this interaction I have developed a C# program which can communicate with the PLC and collect data. This data is than mapped to tags of WinCC.
My part within this project is researching the protocol, designing and programming the application.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Re-Commissioning a grab crane
projects.description:
Working as a commissioning engineer re-commissioning a grab crane after partly refurbished electrical installation. The PLC I/O has changed including the safety concept of the crane and part of the operating concept.
Programming the safety PLC a PNOTZ-Multi from Pilz. Updated and changed parts of the program to control the hydraulically controlled gantry movement, cable tensioning system, signals to the SCADA system and several small optimizations to different parts of the program.
Testing the functionality of the crane according to the required operational task. This includes the safety concept, the limit switches, operational functions, etc.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Teaching C# and Visual Studio
projects.description:
Teaching software engineering students using Visual Studio 2013 and the C# programming language. By presenting a fictitious assignment where they needed to develop a particle system for a customer.

The problem was broken down in pieces they can understand. Every week we build a part of the problem. This was done live so they could follow the reasoning during the process and type along. Questions were addressed as they came up. Keeping in my the difference in programming experience the students have, which lay between 0 and 8 years.
Topics passed during the lessons:
- Using the team foundation services
- Using the test capabilities of Visual Studio
- Scratching the surface of WPF
- Basic C# features and object orientation
- Debugging applications

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Teaching Python for beginners
projects.description:
Started teaching BI-students at HRO in Rotterdam scripting using Python as the scripting language. By presenting the language in clear steps and using examples on subjects they can relate to, I've managed to get them engaged and interested.
The lessons were practical by nature starting with a short explanation of a keyword or a programming principle followed by an example which was made up on the spot. By going through my thought proces in a verbal manner, they could understand the steps involved in creating a program/script. Of course whenever something within these steps was not clear to the students the step would be broken down even further. Sometimes even spinning of a new example.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Commissioning Ship-to-Shore cranes
projects.description:
Commissioning Ship-to-Shore cranes equiped with Siemens 300-series safety PLC, Sinamics with integrated safety and redundant motor configuration options. Commissioning consisted of signal testing, optimizing the control of the Sinamic drives, troubleshooting electrical problems, profibus network, control logic, drive control, etc.
The cranes were commissioned in several countries.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV
Owner, Sonneveld Techniek bv.

projects.title: Commissioning a Stacker / Reclaimer
projects.description:
Commissioning a stacker / reclaimer for coal. From the first signal test on a Siemens 400-series safety PLC, through Sinamics drives with integrated safety, WinCC as SCADA, proportionally controlled hydraulic components and GPS position detection to the functional tests.
This project combines multiple disciplines and a fair amount of interlocking and communication between different systems.
An extensive number of WinCC screens, alarm messages and trend signals for a stacker / reclaimer. Providing the operators and technicians insight in the status of the machine.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Commissioning Ship-to-Shore (STS) cranes in Curacao
projects.description:
Commissioning 2 STS cranes in Curacao as a lead commissioning engineer./programmer. Some parts of the PLC-program were changed during commissioning. Some functionality was added based on last-minute customer requirements.
Technologies used were Siemens S7-1500 safety, Scalance switches with optical fiber, Sinamics S120 and Starter for drive configuration.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Devlopment communication driver
projects.description:
For a company I developed a communication driver to communicate between our Crane Management System and their new crane control PLC. The PLC was the new Siemens S7-1500 series with safety features.
Technologies used were Siemens TIA-portal, C# and Wireshark for network analysis.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Laser based position measurement system
projects.description:
For a sludge handling crane we installed a laser based position measurement system. The installation was performed during operation of the crane, using 2-3 hour production windows to perform physical installation. After each installation cycle we brought the sludge crane back in operational mode. for production. After which we could start the next installation cycle.

For this project I was the main contractor and project leader. An external company was contracted to perform the physical installation.

Technologies used were Siemens S7-300 series PLC, profibus communication, Lase 1D laser scanner with reflectors.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Scrum team member/Scrum master
projects.description:
As a member of a development team we solved questions from the business. These could be in the form of developing tooling, writing instructions, researching difficult to find bugs, optimizing simulation models, etc.  I also developed a PLC-training for internal engineers working on a big project.
Perform tests with wireless communication for industrial ethernet with a communication rail. Determine the communication speed with different equipment setups..

For the testers I've created a simulation tool using PLC Sim Advanced from Siemens. While this is mostly C++ I've created a wrapper for Python. This way the testers could write tests using Python as their language. Which significantly lowered the entry level barrier. Some parts of the development were of course team efforts.

Technologies used were C++, Python, Qt as a library, PLC-Sim Advanced PLC-simulator from Siemens, Siemens TIA-portal, Siemens S7-1500 Series PLC's.

Within this time period I've been also acting as the Scrum master for approximately 6-7 months.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Controlling mooring lines
projects.description:
Developed a PLC-program for a mooring line control system. The system can control 4 mooring lines via a touch panel or from a remote computer. A Siemens S7-1500 series PLC was used a the mooring line control system and controlled Sinamic drives to control the motors.
Technologies used were, Siemens TIA-Portal, Sinamic S-120 drives, Siemens Touchpanel, Start drive to configure the Sinamics.

contributors.headline: Senior Industrial Automation Engineer, Professional C# Developer and Author of the book "Leren programmeren met Python" @ Eye-Concept Industrial Automation BV

projects.title: Waste Bunker Management System
projects.description:
For a waste handling facility we provided a Waste Bunker Management system, which controls a waste handling crane in full automatic mode. For this system the customer requested extra features. These have been analyzed, implemented and tested.
The technologies used were C#, C++ and Microsoft SQL Server.

profile_positions.title: Manager Software Development

profile_positions.description: * Developing and commissioning of applications for full automatic ship-to-shore grab cranes.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Started as a PLC software engineer developing and commissioning PLC applications for mainly container cranes, with an occasional heavy duty overhead crane. Mostly in the area of the Rotterdam harbour, automatic stacking cranes and ship-to-shore cranes from ECT, automatic ship-to-shore fruit handling crane from FTR and automatic ship-to-shore grab cranes from EECV.
Several other projects include grab cranes, heavy duty overhead cranes and ship-to-shore cranes which were located throughout the Netherlands with a couple of them around Europe. These were my main projects.
Started learning the Pascal programming language by developing small utilities. Helping debugging some of the installed applications. This came in handy while troubleshooting at customer sites as a service engineer. Able to handle the electrical, PLC and PC related applications.
Learned the C++ language. Started by porting the Pascal applications with some redesigning to fit the C++ programming paradigm.
